text: I wanted to create a HubSpot module preview emulation locally, and this is what I came up with <https://bitbucket.org/davidDuymelinckMia/HubSpot-local-module-preview>. All comments are welcome
Awesome David, will give it a try real soon. Main issue I still have with the beta is the fact that I have to sync my code to HubSpot before being able to view a module with relevant data.
As it is you can preview data by filling in the input fields below the module output. I didn't find the time yet to support none text fields.

yeah, this will be addressed soon. In the future these files will be downloaded beginning with the `/`. If you want to reference files based on absolute path, then you must start with a forward slash. Relative paths are also accepted here, e.g. `../../Coded_Files/style.css`
going to second svg's here. I use them as much as possible in site design to get those pixel perfect graphics. also animations

okay, what am i doing wrong. i’m stuck on the OAuth in the setup process — it’s telling me “Couldn’t complete the connection The redirect_uri does not match the client registered redirect_uri. Please contact the integrator.”

when I change the redirect URI, it automatically changes the OAuth URI so i see that as a match. i have “Content” scope selected, and i’ve also tried it with no scopes selected.

but the URI the authenticator is going to seems to want to redirect to localhost:3000.  i’ve tried that, and other local URIs. what am i missing. i’m not seeing this covered very well in any documentation.
